results.title: Souvenirs from Sweden
results.creator_credit: Svensk Filmindustri, Svenska filminstitutet and Henning Carlsen
results.brief_description: An unconventional picture of modern Sweden, its people and its natural beauty. Sailing in the archipelago, glass-blowing at Orrefors, the Vasa skiing race, the Nobel Festival - the everyday life of Swedes and their special occasions. (Awards: Grand Prize of the Annual International Travel Film Festival)

results.title: Souvenirs D'en France = Insider Memories of France
results.brief_description:
Pedret, a Spanish migrant, has built a prosperous business in which his three sons, Prosper, Hector, Victor are employed. Prosper has married a girl from the local bourgeoisie who has no interest in the factory and its problems. Hector is married to Berthe, a former laundress, whose strength of character and drive attracts the support of Pedret. He supports her in her attempts to bring in a few changes in the factory management. When WWII breaks out, Berthe refuses to imitate her family who retreats in passive neutrality and becomes heavily involved in the Resistance. Techine’s film explores the relation between history and ‘personal histories’ (the title contains a pun on ‘en France’ and ‘enfance’, childhood), focusing on a family from the 1930s to the 1970s. Awards: French Academy of Cinema (1975): Best Supporting Actress for Marie-France Pisier.

Credits: Producer, Vera Belmont ; director, Andre Techine ; writers, Andre Techine, Marylin Goldin ; photography, Bruno Nuytten ; music, Philippe Sarde.
Cast: Jeanne Moreau, Michel Auclair, Marie-France Pisier, Claude Mann, Orane Demazis.

results.title: Southward ho!: in New Zealand's beautiful South Island
results.brief_description: A travelogue of the South Island showing Queen Charlotte Sound, fishing and picnics, Nelson City and car services to west coast, lakes, glaciers, ferns, Franz Josef Glacier, Christchurch, River Avon, Canterbury College, Lyttleton (port of Christchurch and southern terminus for express steamer service) and much more.

results.title: Southern run
results.brief_description: A documentary following the everyday duties of a single mother working as a stewardess in the cafeteria of a passenger train. The train stops at Goulburn and Junee stations. Music by Mental As Anything.

results.title: Southern Rhodesia: climate and cultivation
results.brief_description: Shows the effect of climate and altitude on the agriculture of Southern Rhodesia. The difference between Low Veld native subsistence farming and High Veld commercial farming. Maps indicate varying altitude and seasonal rainfall which make possible the growing of maize, cotton, tobacco, fruit and barley.
results.description: Shows the effect of climate and altitude on the agriculture of Southern Rhodesia. The difference between Low Veld native subsistence farming and High Veld commercial farming. results.title: Southern comfort
results.creator_credit: Phoenix Films, EMI/Parlophone, Cinema Group, David Giler and Walter Hill
results.brief_description: Louisiana 1973 - a squad from the Louisiana National Guard, together for a weekend reconnaissance exercise in the Louisiana Bayou, are about to experience the fight of their lives against an unexpected enemy. Eight men make up the squad and within this group exists a volatility which is about to tear them apart. Their own private unintentional war begins when they decide to steal three canoes from a Cajun campsite. This action results in unfortunate consequences when trigger-happy Private Stuckey fires blanks at some local Cajuns who have spotted them paddling off in the canoes. Retaliation and revenge follows and the battle for survival begins. Filmed in the Louisiana swamps, director Walter Hill (Crossroads, 48 Hours, Last man standing) has succeeded in creating an atmospheric environ which heightens the tension and adds to the ever-increasing state of paranoia. Surreal and disturbing, “Southern comfort” bears a similarity to “Deliverance” where the environment and the local people become the focus of the story. As in “Deliverance”, music too plays an important part and it is the brilliant Ry Cooder who has composed and arranged the music for this film with cinematography by Andrew Laszlo. Cast includes Keith Carradine, Powers Boothe, Fred Ward, Peter Coyote, Carlos Brown.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Phoenix Films, EMI/Parlophone, Cinema Group, David Giler and Walter Hill

results.title: Southern Belle. Part 2
results.brief_description: This video is the second part of Greg Graingers journey into the Southern part of the United States. Visit states such as Tennessee, Louisiana, Georgia, Alabama, Mississippi, South Carolina and Florida, take time to meet with a wealth of Southern characters and experience the life and customs of the south in a very upbeat and entertaining manner. Visit Dollywood (centre of the business empire of Dolly Parton) and Gracelands (home of the legendary Elvis Presley), paddlewheel down the Mississippi and travel to Nashville for a country music bonanza.
